description: System Security Plan (SSP) document including all required sections per FedRAMP High Baseline requirements
System and communications protection policy and procedures documentation
FIPS 140-2 or FIPS 140-3 validation certificates for all cryptographic modules in use
Cryptographic key management procedures including key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction processes
Network architecture diagrams showing boundary protection devices, subnets, DMZs, and managed interfaces
Firewall and boundary protection device configuration files and rulesets
Evidence of encryption implementation for data in transit (TLS/IPSec configurations)
Evidence of encryption implementation for data at rest across all system components storing Federal data
DNSSEC implementation documentation for authoritative and recursive DNS servers
List of external network connections and access points to the system
Traffic flow policies for each managed interface including documented exceptions
Deny-by-default, allow-by-exception network communications policy and implementation evidence
Split tunneling prevention controls and configuration for remote devices
Authenticated proxy server configurations and routing policies
Data exfiltration prevention controls and testing results
Host-based protection system (HIPS/HIDS/firewall) deployment evidence across all system components
Boundary protection device fail-secure configuration documentation
System component isolation and segregation implementation documentation
Session timeout and network disconnect configuration for privileged and user sessions
Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) certificate policy and approved trust anchor list
Mobile code policy defining acceptable and unacceptable mobile code technologies
Session authenticity protection mechanisms and implementation evidence
System time synchronization configuration with NIST authoritative time sources
Process isolation implementation documentation showing separate execution domains
Denial-of-service protection controls for ICMP flood, SYN flood, slowloris, buffer overflow, and volume attacks
Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for system administration functions
Services, ports, and protocols inventory with justifications for each
Collaborative computing device remote activation controls and user indication mechanisms
Information sharing controls for shared system resources to prevent unauthorized information transfer
Security function isolation implementation showing separation of security and non-security functions
